00210 BOOLEAN InitializeVideoManager(HINSTANCE hInstance, UINT16 usCommandShow, void *WindowProc)
00211 { 
00212   UINT32        uiIndex, uiPitch;
00213   HRESULT       ReturnCode;
00214   HWND          hWindow;
00215   WNDCLASS      WindowClass;
00216   UINT8         ClassName[] = APPLICATION_NAME;
00217   DDSURFACEDESC SurfaceDescription;
00218   DDCOLORKEY    ColorKey;
00219   PTR           pTmpPointer;
00220 
00221 #ifndef WINDOWED_MODE
00222   DDSCAPS       SurfaceCaps;
00223 #endif
00224 
00225 
00226   //
00227   // Register debug topics
00228   //
00229 
00230   RegisterDebugTopic(TOPIC_VIDEO, "Video");
00231   DebugMsg(TOPIC_VIDEO, DBG_LEVEL_0, "Initializing the video manager");
00232 
00233   /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00234   //
00235   // Register and Realize our display window. The DirectX surface will eventually overlay on top 
00236   // of this surface. 
00237   //
00238   // <<<<<<<<< Don't change this >>>>>>>>
00239   //
00240   /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00241   
00242   WindowClass.style = CS_HREDRAW | CS_VREDRAW;
00243   WindowClass.lpfnWndProc = (WNDPROC) WindowProc;
00244   WindowClass.cbClsExtra = 0;
00245   WindowClass.cbWndExtra = 0;
00246   WindowClass.hInstance = hInstance;
00247   WindowClass.hIcon = LoadIcon(hInstance, MAKEINTRESOURCE( IDI_ICON1 ) );
00248   WindowClass.hCursor = NULL;
00249   WindowClass.hbrBackground = NULL;
00250   WindowClass.lpszMenuName = NULL;
00251   WindowClass.lpszClassName = (LPCSTR) ClassName;
00252   RegisterClass(&WindowClass);
00253 
00254   //
00255   // Get a window handle for our application (gotta have on of those)
00256   // Don't change this
00257   //
00258 #ifdef WINDOWED_MODE
00259   hWindow = CreateWindowEx(0, (LPCSTR) ClassName, "Windowed JA2 !!", WS_POPUP, 0, 0, SCREEN_WIDTH, SCREEN_HEIGHT, NULL, NULL, hInstance, NULL);
00260 #else
00261   hWindow = CreateWindowEx(WS_EX_TOPMOST, (LPCSTR) ClassName, (LPCSTR)ClassName, WS_POPUP | WS_VISIBLE, 0, 0, GetSystemMetrics(SM_CXSCREEN), GetSystemMetrics(SM_CYSCREEN), NULL, NULL, hInstance, NULL);
00262 #endif
00263   if (hWindow == NULL)
00264   { 
00265     DebugMsg(TOPIC_VIDEO, DBG_LEVEL_0, "Failed to create window frame for Direct Draw");
00266     return FALSE;
00267   }
00268 
00269   //
00270   // Excellent. Now we record the hWindow variable for posterity (not)
00271   //
00272 
00273       memset( gpFrameData, 0, sizeof( gpFrameData ) );
00274 
00275 
00276   ghWindow = hWindow;
00277 
00278   //
00279   // Display our full screen window
00280   //
00281 
00282   ShowCursor(FALSE);
00283   ShowWindow(hWindow, usCommandShow);
00284   UpdateWindow(hWindow);
00285   SetFocus(hWindow);
00286   
00287   /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00288   //
00289   // Start up Direct Draw
00290   //
00291   /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00292 
00293   //
00294   // Create the Direct Draw Object
00295   //
00296 
00297   ReturnCode = DirectDrawCreate(NULL, &_gpDirectDrawObject, NULL);
00298   if (ReturnCode != DD_OK)
00299   { 
00300     DirectXAttempt ( ReturnCode, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00301     return FALSE;
00302   }
00303     
00304       ReturnCode = IDirectDraw_QueryInterface( _gpDirectDrawObject, /*&*/IID_IDirectDraw2, (LPVOID *) &gpDirectDrawObject ); // (jonathanl)
00305   if (ReturnCode != DD_OK)
00306   { 
00307     DirectXAttempt ( ReturnCode, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00308     return FALSE;
00309       }
00310 
00311   //
00312   // Set the exclusive mode
00313   //
00314 #ifdef WINDOWED_MODE
00315       ReturnCode = IDirectDraw2_SetCooperativeLevel(gpDirectDrawObject, ghWindow, DDSCL_NORMAL );
00316 #else
00317       ReturnCode = IDirectDraw2_SetCooperativeLevel(gpDirectDrawObject, ghWindow, DDSCL_EXCLUSIVE | DDSCL_FULLSCREEN );
00318 #endif
00319   if (ReturnCode != DD_OK)
00320   { 
00321     DirectXAttempt ( ReturnCode, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00322     return FALSE;
00323   }
00324     
00325   //
00326   // Set the display mode
00327   //
00328 #ifndef WINDOWED_MODE
00329   ReturnCode = IDirectDraw2_SetDisplayMode( gpDirectDrawObject, SCREEN_WIDTH, SCREEN_HEIGHT, gbPixelDepth, 0, 0 );
00330   if (ReturnCode != DD_OK)
00331   { 
00332     DirectXAttempt ( ReturnCode, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00333     return FALSE;
00334   }
00335 #endif
00336 
00337   gusScreenWidth = SCREEN_WIDTH;
00338   gusScreenHeight = SCREEN_HEIGHT;
00339   gubScreenPixelDepth = gbPixelDepth;
00340     
00341   /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00342   //
00343   // Setup all the surfaces
00344   //
00345   /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00346 
00347   //
00348   // Initialize Primary Surface along with BackBuffer
00349   //
00350 
00351   ZEROMEM(SurfaceDescription);
00352 #ifdef WINDOWED_MODE
00353 
00354       // Create a primary surface and a backbuffer in system memory
00355   SurfaceDescription.dwSize = sizeof(DDSURFACEDESC);
00356   SurfaceDescription.dwFlags = DDSD_CAPS;
00357   SurfaceDescription.ddsCaps.dwCaps = DDSCAPS_PRIMARYSURFACE;
00358 
00359   ReturnCode = IDirectDraw2_CreateSurface ( gpDirectDrawObject, &SurfaceDescription, &_gpPrimarySurface, NULL );
00360   if (ReturnCode != DD_OK)
00361   { 
00362     DirectXAttempt ( ReturnCode, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00363     return FALSE;
00364   }
00365 
00366 
00367   ReturnCode = IDirectDrawSurface_QueryInterface(_gpPrimarySurface, /*&*/IID_IDirectDrawSurface2, (LPVOID *)&gpPrimarySurface); // (jonathanl)

00369   { 
00370     DirectXAttempt ( ReturnCode, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00371     return FALSE;
00372   }
00373 
00374       // Backbuffer
00375   ZEROMEM(SurfaceDescription);
00376   SurfaceDescription.dwSize         = sizeof(DDSURFACEDESC);
00377   SurfaceDescription.dwFlags        = DDSD_CAPS | DDSD_WIDTH | DDSD_HEIGHT;
00378   SurfaceDescription.ddsCaps.dwCaps = DDSCAPS_OFFSCREENPLAIN | DDSCAPS_SYSTEMMEMORY;
00379   SurfaceDescription.dwWidth        = SCREEN_WIDTH;
00380   SurfaceDescription.dwHeight       = SCREEN_HEIGHT;

00385     return FALSE;

00392     DirectXAttempt ( ReturnCode, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00393     return FALSE;
00394   }
00395 
00396 
00397 #else
00398   SurfaceDescription.dwSize = sizeof(DDSURFACEDESC);
00399   SurfaceDescription.dwFlags = DDSD_CAPS | DDSD_BACKBUFFERCOUNT;
00400   SurfaceDescription.ddsCaps.dwCaps = DDSCAPS_PRIMARYSURFACE | DDSCAPS_FLIP | DDSCAPS_COMPLEX;
00401   SurfaceDescription.dwBackBufferCount = 1;
00402 
00403   ReturnCode = IDirectDraw2_CreateSurface ( gpDirectDrawObject, &SurfaceDescription, &_gpPrimarySurface, NULL );

00407     return FALSE;
00408   }

00462   //

00556       return FALSE;
00557     }

00560   //

00562   //

00564       // ATE: Keep these mutexes for now!
00565   if (InitializeMutex(REFRESH_THREAD_MUTEX, (UINT8 *)"RefreshThreadMutex") == FALSE)
00566   {
00567     return FALSE;
00568   }
00569   if (InitializeMutex(FRAME_BUFFER_MUTEX, (UINT8 *)"FrameBufferMutex") == FALSE)
00570   {
00571     return FALSE;
00572   }
00573   if (InitializeMutex(MOUSE_BUFFER_MUTEX, (UINT8 *)"MouseBufferMutex") == FALSE)
00574   {
00575     return FALSE;
00576   }
00577 
00578   //
00579   // Initialize state variables
00580   //
00581 
00582   guiFrameBufferState          = BUFFER_DIRTY;
00583   guiMouseBufferState          = BUFFER_DISABLED;
00584   guiVideoManagerState         = VIDEO_ON;

00595   //
00596 
00597   GetRGBDistribution();
00598 
00599 
00600   return TRUE;
00601 }

00603 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00604 void ShutdownVideoManager(void)
00605 { 
00606   //UINT32  uiRefreshThreadState;
00607 
00608       DebugMsg(TOPIC_VIDEO, DBG_LEVEL_0, "Shutting down the video manager"); 
00609 
00610   //
00611   // Toggle the state of the video manager to indicate to the refresh thread that it needs to shut itself
00612   // down
00613   //
00614 
00615   IDirectDrawSurface2_Release(gpMouseCursorOriginal);
00616   IDirectDrawSurface2_Release(gpMouseCursor);
00617   IDirectDrawSurface2_Release(gMouseCursorBackground[0].pSurface);
00618   IDirectDrawSurface2_Release(gpBackBuffer);
00619   IDirectDrawSurface2_Release(gpPrimarySurface);
00620 
00621   IDirectDraw2_RestoreDisplayMode( gpDirectDrawObject );
00622   IDirectDraw2_SetCooperativeLevel(gpDirectDrawObject, ghWindow, DDSCL_NORMAL );
00623   IDirectDraw2_Release( gpDirectDrawObject );
00624 
00625   // destroy the window
00626   // DestroyWindow( ghWindow );
00627 
00628   guiVideoManagerState = VIDEO_OFF;
00629 
00630   if (gpCursorStore != NULL)
00631   {
00632     DeleteVideoObject(gpCursorStore);
00633     gpCursorStore = NULL;
00634   }
00635 
00636   // ATE: Release mouse cursor!
00637   FreeMouseCursor( );
00638 
00639   UnRegisterDebugTopic(TOPIC_VIDEO, "Video"); 
00640 }

00643 
00644 void SuspendVideoManager(void)
00645 {
00646   guiVideoManagerState = VIDEO_SUSPENDED;
00647 
00648 }
00649 
00650 void DoTester( )
00651 {
00652   IDirectDraw2_RestoreDisplayMode( gpDirectDrawObject );
00653   IDirectDraw2_SetCooperativeLevel(gpDirectDrawObject, ghWindow, DDSCL_NORMAL );
00654   ShowCursor(TRUE);
00655 }

00657 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00658 
00659 BOOLEAN RestoreVideoManager(void)
00660 { 
00661       HRESULT ReturnCode;
00662   
00663   //
00664   // Make sure the video manager is indeed suspended before moving on
00665   //
00666 
00667   if (guiVideoManagerState == VIDEO_SUSPENDED)
00668   {
00669     //
00670     // Restore the Primary and Backbuffer
00671     //
00672 
00673     ReturnCode = IDirectDrawSurface2_Restore( gpPrimarySurface );
00674     if (ReturnCode != DD_OK)
00675     {
00676       DirectXAttempt ( ReturnCode, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00677       return FALSE;
00678     }
00679 
00680     ReturnCode = IDirectDrawSurface2_Restore( gpBackBuffer );
00681     if (ReturnCode != DD_OK)
00682     {
00683       DirectXAttempt ( ReturnCode, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00684       return FALSE;
00685     }
00686 
00687     //
00688         // Restore the mouse surfaces and make sure to initialize the gpMouseCursor surface
00689     //
00690     
00691     ReturnCode = IDirectDrawSurface2_Restore( gMouseCursorBackground[0].pSurface );
00692     if (ReturnCode != DD_OK)
00693     {
00694       DirectXAttempt ( ReturnCode, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00695       return FALSE;
00696     }
00697 
00698     ReturnCode = IDirectDrawSurface2_Restore( gpMouseCursor );
00699     if (ReturnCode != DD_OK)
00700     {
00701       DirectXAttempt ( ReturnCode, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00702       return FALSE;
00703     } else
00704     {
00705       guiMouseBufferState = BUFFER_DIRTY;
00706     }
00707 
00708     // 
00709     // Set the video state to VIDEO_ON
00710     //
00711     
00712     guiFrameBufferState = BUFFER_DIRTY;
00713     guiMouseBufferState = BUFFER_DIRTY;
00714     gfForceFullScreenRefresh = TRUE;
00715     guiVideoManagerState = VIDEO_ON;
00716     return TRUE;
00717       }
00718   else
00719   {
00720     return FALSE;  
00721   }   
00722 }
00723 
00724 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00725 
00726 void GetCurrentVideoSettings( UINT16 *usWidth, UINT16 *usHeight, UINT8 *ubBitDepth )
00727 {
00728       *usWidth = (UINT16) gusScreenWidth;
00729       *usHeight = (UINT16) gusScreenHeight;
00730       *ubBitDepth = (UINT8) gubScreenPixelDepth;
00731 }
00732 
00733 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00734 
00735 BOOLEAN CanBlitToFrameBuffer(void)
00736 {
00737   BOOLEAN fCanBlit;
00738 
00739   //
00740   // W A R N I N G ---- W A R N I N G ---- W A R N I N G ---- W A R N I N G ---- W A R N I N G ----
00741   //
00742   // This function is intended to be called by a thread which has already locked the
00743   // FRAME_BUFFER_MUTEX mutual exclusion section. Anything else will cause the application to
00744   // yack
00745   //
00746 
00747   fCanBlit = (guiFrameBufferState == BUFFER_READY);
00748 
00749   return fCanBlit;
00750 }
00751 
00752 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00753 
00754 BOOLEAN CanBlitToMouseBuffer(void)
00755 {
00756   BOOLEAN fCanBlit;
00757 
00758   //
00759   // W A R N I N G ---- W A R N I N G ---- W A R N I N G ---- W A R N I N G ---- W A R N I N G ----
00760   //
00761   // This function is intended to be called by a thread which has already locked the
00762   // MOUSE_BUFFER_MUTEX mutual exclusion section. Anything else will cause the application to
00763   // yack
00764   //
00765 
00766   fCanBlit = (guiMouseBufferState == BUFFER_READY);
00767 
00768   return fCanBlit;
00769 }
00770 
00771 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00772 
00773 void InvalidateRegion(INT32 iLeft, INT32 iTop, INT32 iRight, INT32 iBottom)
00774 {
00775   if (gfForceFullScreenRefresh == TRUE)
00776   {
00777     //
00778     // There's no point in going on since we are forcing a full screen refresh
00779     //
00780 
00781     return;
00782   }
00783 
00784   if (guiDirtyRegionCount < MAX_DIRTY_REGIONS)
00785   {
00786     //
00787     // Well we haven't broken the MAX_DIRTY_REGIONS limit yet, so we register the new region
00788     //
00789 
00790             // DO SOME PREMIMARY CHECKS FOR VALID RECTS
00791             if ( iLeft < 0 )
00792                         iLeft = 0;
00793 
00794             if ( iTop < 0 )
00795                         iTop = 0;
00796 
00797             if ( iRight > SCREEN_WIDTH )
00798                         iRight = SCREEN_WIDTH;
00799 
00800             if ( iBottom > SCREEN_HEIGHT )
00801                         iBottom = SCREEN_HEIGHT;
00802 
00803             if (  ( iRight - iLeft ) <= 0 )
00804                         return;
00805 
00806             if (  ( iBottom - iTop ) <= 0 )
00807                         return;
00808 
00809     gListOfDirtyRegions[guiDirtyRegionCount].iLeft   = iLeft;
00810     gListOfDirtyRegions[guiDirtyRegionCount].iTop    = iTop;
00811     gListOfDirtyRegions[guiDirtyRegionCount].iRight  = iRight;
00812     gListOfDirtyRegions[guiDirtyRegionCount].iBottom = iBottom;
00813 
00814 //          gDirtyRegionFlags[ guiDirtyRegionCount ] = TRUE;
00815 
00816     guiDirtyRegionCount++;
00817 
00818   }
00819   else
00820   {
00821     //
00822     // The MAX_DIRTY_REGIONS limit has been exceeded. Therefore we arbitrarely invalidate the entire
00823     // screen and force a full screen refresh
00824     //
00825     guiDirtyRegionExCount = 0;
00826     guiDirtyRegionCount = 0;
00827     gfForceFullScreenRefresh = TRUE;
00828   }
00829 }
00830 
00831 
00832 void InvalidateRegionEx(INT32 iLeft, INT32 iTop, INT32 iRight, INT32 iBottom, UINT32 uiFlags )
00833 {
00834       INT32 iOldBottom;
00835 
00836       iOldBottom = iBottom;
00837 
00838       // Check if we are spanning the rectangle - if so slit it up!
00839       if ( iTop <= gsVIEWPORT_WINDOW_END_Y && iBottom > gsVIEWPORT_WINDOW_END_Y )
00840       {
00841                   // Add new top region
00842                   iBottom                       = gsVIEWPORT_WINDOW_END_Y;
00843                   AddRegionEx( iLeft, iTop, iRight, iBottom, uiFlags );
00844                   
00845                   // Add new bottom region
00846                   iTop   = gsVIEWPORT_WINDOW_END_Y;
00847                   iBottom     = iOldBottom;
00848                   AddRegionEx( iLeft, iTop, iRight, iBottom, uiFlags );
00849                                                                               
00850       }
00851       else
00852       {
00853              AddRegionEx( iLeft, iTop, iRight, iBottom, uiFlags );
00854       }
00855 }
00856 
00857 
00858 void AddRegionEx(INT32 iLeft, INT32 iTop, INT32 iRight, INT32 iBottom, UINT32 uiFlags )
00859 {
00860 
00861   if (guiDirtyRegionExCount < MAX_DIRTY_REGIONS)
00862   {
00863 
00864             // DO SOME PREMIMARY CHECKS FOR VALID RECTS
00865             if ( iLeft < 0 )
00866                         iLeft = 0;
00867 
00868             if ( iTop < 0 )
00869                         iTop = 0;
00870 
00871             if ( iRight > SCREEN_WIDTH )
00872                         iRight = SCREEN_WIDTH;
00873 
00874             if ( iBottom > SCREEN_HEIGHT )
00875                         iBottom = SCREEN_HEIGHT;
00876 
00877             if (  ( iRight - iLeft ) <= 0 )
00878                         return;
00879 
00880             if (  ( iBottom - iTop ) <= 0 )
00881                         return;
00882 
00883 
00884 
00885     gDirtyRegionsEx[ guiDirtyRegionExCount ].iLeft   = iLeft;
00886     gDirtyRegionsEx[ guiDirtyRegionExCount ].iTop    = iTop;
00887     gDirtyRegionsEx[ guiDirtyRegionExCount ].iRight  = iRight;
00888     gDirtyRegionsEx[ guiDirtyRegionExCount ].iBottom = iBottom;
00889 
00890             gDirtyRegionsFlagsEx[ guiDirtyRegionExCount ] = uiFlags;
00891 
00892     guiDirtyRegionExCount++;
00893 
00894   }
00895       else
00896       {
00897     guiDirtyRegionExCount = 0;
00898     guiDirtyRegionCount = 0;
00899     gfForceFullScreenRefresh = TRUE;
00900 
00901       }
00902 }
00903 
00904 
00905 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00906 
00907 void InvalidateRegions(SGPRect *pArrayOfRegions, UINT32 uiRegionCount)
00908 {
00909   if (gfForceFullScreenRefresh == TRUE)
00910   {
00911     //
00912     // There's no point in going on since we are forcing a full screen refresh
00913     //
00914 
00915     return;
00916   }
00917 
00918   if ((guiDirtyRegionCount + uiRegionCount) < MAX_DIRTY_REGIONS)
00919   {
00920     UINT32 uiIndex;
00921 
00922     for (uiIndex = 0; uiIndex < uiRegionCount; uiIndex++)
00923     {
00924       //
00925       // Well we haven't broken the MAX_DIRTY_REGIONS limit yet, so we register the new region
00926       //
00927 
00928       gListOfDirtyRegions[guiDirtyRegionCount].iLeft   = pArrayOfRegions[uiIndex].iLeft;
00929       gListOfDirtyRegions[guiDirtyRegionCount].iTop    = pArrayOfRegions[uiIndex].iTop;
00930       gListOfDirtyRegions[guiDirtyRegionCount].iRight  = pArrayOfRegions[uiIndex].iRight;
00931       gListOfDirtyRegions[guiDirtyRegionCount].iBottom = pArrayOfRegions[uiIndex].iBottom;
00932 
00933       guiDirtyRegionCount++; 
00934     }    
00935   }
00936   else
00937   {
00938     guiDirtyRegionCount = 0;
00939     gfForceFullScreenRefresh = TRUE;    
00940   }
00941 }
00942 
00943 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00944 
00945 void InvalidateScreen(void)
00946 {
00947   //
00948   // W A R N I N G ---- W A R N I N G ---- W A R N I N G ---- W A R N I N G ---- W A R N I N G ----
00949   //
00950   // This function is intended to be called by a thread which has already locked the
00951   // FRAME_BUFFER_MUTEX mutual exclusion section. Anything else will cause the application to
00952   // yack
00953   //
00954 
00955   guiDirtyRegionCount = 0;
00956   guiDirtyRegionExCount = 0;
00957   gfForceFullScreenRefresh = TRUE;
00958   guiFrameBufferState = BUFFER_DIRTY;
00959 }
00960

00964 {
00965   //
00966   // W A R N I N G ---- W A R N I N G ---- W A R N I N G ---- W A R N I N G ---- W A R N I N G ----
00967   //
00968   // This function is intended to be called by a thread which has already locked the
00969   // FRAME_BUFFER_MUTEX mutual exclusion section. Anything else will cause the application to
00970   // yack
00971   //
00972 
00973   guiFrameBufferState = BUFFER_DIRTY;
00974 }
